intro: Psychotria descoingsii, commonly known as the Madagascar morning glory, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, elliptical leaves. Its flowers are short-lived but attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Psychotria descoingsii is also notable for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its efficacy.
